labels.analysis: The MCP Server for PocketBase is primarily focused on database and collection management within PocketBase. It provides tools for CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on records, file uploads and downloads, and migration management (creating, applying, and reverting migrations). The server also includes logging capabilities to track and analyze API request activities. It solves problems related to efficient database operations, schema management through migrations, and monitoring API traffic.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Database Operations" is chosen because the server is heavily focused on managing PocketBase collections, schema, and records. "Memory Management" is included as a secondary label because the server handles file uploads and downloads, which involve data storage and retrieval. "Development Tools" is also relevant due to migration management, which is a common need in development environments.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: PocketBase MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mabeldata/pocketbase-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your PocketBase collections effortlessly. Fetch, create, update, and delete records with ease, while also handling file uploads and downloads. Streamline your database operations and enhance your application's capabilities with this powerful server.

tools.name: fetch_record
tools.description: Deploy Server PocketBase MCP Server @mabeldata/pocketbase-mcp Try in Playground fetch_record

tools.name: list_records
tools.description: List records from a PocketBase collection. Supports filtering, sorting, pagination, and expansion.

tools.name: create_record
tools.description: Create a new record in a PocketBase collection.

tools.name: update_record
tools.description: Update an existing record in a PocketBase collection by ID.

tools.name: get_collection_schema
tools.description: Get the schema (fields, rules, etc.) of a PocketBase collection.

tools.name: list_collections
tools.description: List all collections in the PocketBase instance.

tools.name: upload_file
tools.description: Upload a file (provided as content string) to a PocketBase collection record field.

tools.name: download_file
tools.description: Get the URL to download a file from a PocketBase collection record field.

tools.name: set_migrations_directory
tools.description: Set the directory where migration files will be created and read from.

tools.name: create_migration
tools.description: Create a new, empty PocketBase migration file with a timestamped name.

tools.name: create_collection_migration
tools.description: Create a migration file specifically for creating a new PocketBase collection.

tools.name: add_field_migration
tools.description: Create a migration file for adding a field to an existing collection.

tools.name: list_migrations
tools.description: List all migration files found in the PocketBase migrations directory.

tools.name: apply_migration
tools.description: Apply a specific migration file.

tools.name: revert_migration
tools.description: Revert a specific migration file.

tools.name: apply_all_migrations
tools.description: Apply all pending migrations.

tools.name: revert_to_migration
tools.description: Revert migrations up to a specific target.

tools.name: list_logs
tools.description: List API request logs from PocketBase with filtering, sorting, and pagination.

tools.name: get_log
tools.description: Get a single API request log by ID.

tools.name: get_logs_stats
tools.description: Get API request logs statistics with optional filtering.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mabeldata/pocketbase-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
